scenarios.name: The Quick Purchase
scenarios.description: A simple, time-sensitive purchase with clear criteria. Best suited for single agent approach.
scenarios.learningObjective: Demonstrates when a single agent is the most efficient choice. Simple tasks with clear criteria don't need the overhead of multi-agent coordination.

scenarios.name: The Informed Decision
scenarios.description: A complex purchase requiring specialized analysis across multiple dimensions. Best suited for multi-agent approach.
scenarios.goal: Purchase wireless headphones for work-from-home use
scenarios.learningObjective: Shows the value of specialized agents. A Price Agent can analyze value, a Quality Agent can evaluate specs, and a User Preference Agent can match to work-from-home needs. The orchestrator synthesizes these perspectives into a better decision.

scenarios.name: The Balanced Choice
scenarios.description: A purchase where budget, quality, speed, AND sustainability all matter equally. Requires negotiation between competing priorities.
scenarios.goal: Buy a gift for an eco-conscious friend who values quality but you have limited budget and time
constraints: Budget $40-80 (want to save but not look cheap)
Must arrive within 5 days (birthday coming up)
Must be high quality (friend appreciates craftsmanship)
scenarios.learningObjective: Demonstrates when peer debate adds value. With four competing priorities (budget, quality, speed, sustainability), having specialized advocates debate and negotiate leads to a more balanced decision than a single perspective.

scenarios.name: The Smart Shopper
scenarios.description: A purchase where historical data, price trends, and review analysis are crucial. Best suited for MCP tool-enhanced approach.
scenarios.goal: Find the best deal on a popular electronics item by analyzing price history and reviews
constraints: Want the best VALUE not just lowest price
Need to verify the product quality through reviews
Prefer buying when price is at/near lowest
requirements: Check if current price is good vs historical
Analyze review sentiment and common issues
Find any active deals or discounts
scenarios.learningObjective: Demonstrates the power of tool use. The MCP agent can query price history databases, analyze review sentiment, find deals, and compare products using external tools - providing data-driven insights that pure reasoning cannot match.

scenarios.name: The Impossible Task
scenarios.description: A scenario with contradictory requirements designed to show how agents handle failure gracefully.
scenarios.goal: Find the perfect product meeting ALL requirements
constraints: Must be the absolute cheapest option
Must be the highest quality available
Must be the most eco-friendly option
scenarios.bestApproachNote: Single 'wins' by failing fastest and cheapest - don't throw expensive architectures at unsolvable problems
scenarios.learningObjective: Demonstrates graceful failure handling. Good agents recognize impossible requirements and explain trade-offs rather than pretending to succeed. This scenario teaches that agents have limitations and should communicate them clearly.
